title: Unit 5 Checkpoint: Exponential & Logarithmic Functions
description: Assessment covering logarithm evaluation and exponential-logarithmic conversion, properties of logarithms (expanding and condensing), solving exponential and logarithmic equations with domain checks, and real-world modeling with compound interest, half-life, and population growth.

remediationResources.focusArea: Evaluating logs and converting between exponential and logarithmic form
Product, quotient, and power rules for expanding and condensing
Solving exponential equations using common bases and logarithms
Solving logarithmic equations and checking for extraneous solutions
Compound interest, half-life, and continuous growth models

assessmentProblems.question: Evaluate each logarithm: (a) log₂(32)  (b) log₅(1/125)  (c) ln(e³)
Convert between forms: (a) Rewrite log₇(343) = 3 in exponential form. (b) Rewrite 4⁻² = 1/16 in logarithmic form. (c) Evaluate log₉(1).
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) 7³ = 343. (b) log₄(1/16) = -2. (c) 0, because log₉(1) = 0 (any base raised to 0 equals 1).

assessmentProblems.question: Expand completely using properties of logarithms: log₃(x⁴y / z²).
assessmentProblems.answer: 4log₃(x) + log₃(y) - 2log₃(z). Quotient rule first: log₃(x⁴y) - log₃(z²). Product rule: log₃(x⁴) + log₃(y) - log₃(z²). Power rule: 4log₃(x) + log₃(y) - 2log₃(z).

assessmentProblems.question: Condense into a single logarithm: 3ln(x) + (1/2)ln(y) - 4ln(z).
assessmentProblems.answer: ln(x³√y / z⁴). Power rule: ln(x³) + ln(y^(1/2)) - ln(z⁴). Product rule: ln(x³√y) - ln(z⁴). Quotient rule: ln(x³√y / z⁴).

assessmentProblems.question: Solve the exponential equation: 5^(2x - 1) = 125.
assessmentProblems.answer: x = 2. Rewrite 125 as 5³: 5^(2x - 1) = 5³. Set exponents equal: 2x - 1 = 3. Solve: 2x = 4, x = 2.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve and check for extraneous solutions: log₂(x + 3) + log₂(x - 1) = 5.
assessmentProblems.answer: x = 5. Combine: log₂((x + 3)(x - 1)) = 5. Convert: (x + 3)(x - 1) = 32. Expand: x² + 2x - 3 = 32. Simplify: x² + 2x - 35 = 0. Factor: (x + 7)(x - 5) = 0. x = -7 or x = 5. Domain check: log arguments must be positive, so x > 1. x = -7 is extraneous. Check x = 5: log₂(8) + log₂(4) = 3 + 2 = 5 ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: $5,000 is invested at 8% annual interest compounded quarterly. Using A = P(1 + r/n)^(nt), find the amount after 10 years. Round to the nearest cent.
A radioactive substance has a half-life of 12 years. If the initial amount is 200 grams: (a) Write a function A(t) for the amount remaining after t years. (b) How much remains after 36 years?
Solve: e^(2x) = 15. Give the exact answer and a decimal approximation rounded to three decimal places.
assessmentProblems.answer: Exact: x = ln(15)/2. Approximate: x ≈ 2.708/2 ≈ 1.354. Take ln of both sides: 2x = ln(15). Divide by 2: x = ln(15)/2 ≈ 1.354.

assessmentProblems.question: A town's population grows continuously according to P(t) = P₀e^(kt), where t is years after 2010. The population was 25,000 in 2010 and 32,000 in 2020. (a) Find the continuous growth rate k (exact and approximate). (b) Predict the population in 2030. (c) In what year will the population reach 50,000?
